subject: Career
title: Slack Etiquette and Async Communication
description: A fast breakdown of Slack Etiquette and Async Communication for builders.

hook.text: 'Hey.' That's it. The message. Now you're waiting, anxious, for whatever comes next. Don't be that person.

buildup.text: Async communication means people respond on their schedule. Your message must be self-contained.

discovery.text: The best Slack messages include: context, question, and what you've already tried ‚Äî all in one message.

twist.text: 'No hello' is a movement. Leading with the full question respects everyone's time.

climax.text: Use threads, not channels, for discussions. Tag only who needs to act. Use reactions to acknowledge.

punchline.text: Good async messages don't need follow-ups. They're complete on arrival.

quiz.question: What makes a good async Slack message?
options: Context, question, and what you've tried ‚Äî all in one message
